doc.previous: Suicidal defences by workers are also noted in a Brazilian ant Forelius pusillus where a small group of ants leaves the security of the nest after sealing the entrance from the outside each evening 81
doc.after: In addition to defence against predators ants need to protect their colonies from pathogens Some worker ants maintain the hygiene of the colony and their activities include undertaking or necrophory the disposal of dead nest mates 82 Oleic acid has been identified as the compound released from dead ants that triggers necrophoric behaviour in Atta mexicana 83 while workers of Linepithema humile react to the absence of characteristic chemicals dolichodial and iridomyrmecin present on the cuticle of their living nestmates to trigger similar behaviour 84
